item.title: Report E-2025030194
item.description:
Report E-2025030194

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 14, 2025, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of printing ink were crushed and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all product. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) additional 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025030183
item.description:
Report E-2025030183

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 13, 2025, a Veolia employee was unloading a truck at Veolia's 10-day in-transit facility in Phoenix, AZ. While using an electric pallet, the employee elevated the forks and accidentally punctured the drum, causing 2 gallons to spill onto the cement. Veolia personnel immediately responded and mitigated the spill. The punctured drum was overpacked to prevent any further release of material.

item.title: Report E-2025030179
item.description:
Report E-2025030179

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 12, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the trailer. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 30-gallon drum and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum.
